channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Senate sends shutdown-ending legislation to the House for a vote
item.description: The House could return as early as Wednesday to vote to reopen the government. But many Democrats say they will not support the deal, and some Republicans may not be inclined to vote for it either.
item.content:encoded: The House could return as early as Wednesday to vote to reopen the government. But many Democrats say they will not support the deal, and some Republicans may not be inclined to vote for it either.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Rep. Mike Quigley, D-Ill., shares why he opposes the Senate shutdown deal
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Illinois Democrat Mike Quigley, who serves on the House Appropriations Committee, about his opposition to the Senate-brokered shutdown deal.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Illinois Democrat Mike Quigley, who serves on the House Appropriations Committee, about his opposition to the Senate-brokered shutdown deal.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Trump floats tariff 'dividends' even while plan shows major flaws
item.description: President Trump says the government will distribute checks to Americans from tariff revenue. Here's what that could mean.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says the government will distribute checks to Americans from tariff revenue. Here's what that could mean.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Climate negotiations have started. Here's how far countries need to go
item.description: Nations have begun climate negotiations at the COP30 summit in Brazil. Studies show the world is not on track to avoid the most damaging impacts of climate change.
item.content:encoded: Nations have begun climate negotiations at the COP30 summit in Brazil. Studies show the world is not on track to avoid the most damaging impacts of climate change.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer

item.title: When the dust settles on the shutdown deal, Democrats will likely still have the edge
item.description: As the Senate moves forward a deal to end the government shutdown, it's time to assess the winners, the losers and what the political fallout might look like into the future.
item.content:encoded:
As the Senate moves forward a deal to end the government shutdown, it's time to assess the winners, the losers and what the political fallout might look like into the future.

(Image credit: Tom Brenner)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The House will soon vote on a measure to reopen the government, a look at the shutdown's political fallout, nations confront stalled action to address climate change at COP30.
item.content:encoded: The House will soon vote on a measure to reopen the government, a look at the shutdown's political fallout, nations confront stalled action to address climate change at COP30.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: James Vanderbilt's 'Nuremberg' explores the human horror in a Nazi leader's story
item.description: James Vanderbilt's Nuremberg focuses on the relationship between the Nazis' number two Hermann Göring (Russell Crowe) and Douglas Kelley (Rami Malek), the psychiatrist tasked with monitoring him.
item.content:encoded:
Nuremberg.'/>

James Vanderbilt's Nuremberg focuses on the relationship between the Nazis' number two Hermann Göring (Russell Crowe) and Douglas Kelley (Rami Malek), the psychiatrist tasked with monitoring him.

(Image credit: Scott Garfield)
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: 'Not what any of us signed up for': National Guard members on Trump's deployments
item.description: NPR sat down with several National Guard members in Ohio to talk through how they feel about President Trump's deployments to U.S. cities and the role the guard is playing.
item.content:encoded: NPR sat down with several National Guard members in Ohio to talk through how they feel about President Trump's deployments to U.S. cities and the role the guard is playing.
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: College student with cerebral palsy returns to clinic that transformed her life
item.description: A 21-year old college student with cerebral palsy experienced a full circle moment when she got a chance to work with researchers at a clinic that helped change her life as a child.
item.content:encoded: A 21-year old college student with cerebral palsy experienced a full circle moment when she got a chance to work with researchers at a clinic that helped change her life as a child.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Kraker

item.title: Israel extends detention of Florida teen accused of stone-throwing
item.description: Israel has extended the detention of a Florida teen accused of throwing stones in the West Bank. He's been held nearly nine months without a trial and faces up to 20 years if convicted.
item.content:encoded: Israel has extended the detention of a Florida teen accused of throwing stones in the West Bank. He's been held nearly nine months without a trial and faces up to 20 years if convicted.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer
